info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 3:04PM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
At 304 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Camp Verde, moving northeast at 5 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible.
Locations impacted include... Camp Verde, Montezuma Castle National Monument, Beaverhead Flat, Lake Montezuma, Fort Verde State Historic Park, Cornville, Montezuma Well, Verde Lakes, Wet Beaver Creek Day Use Area, Verde Village, Cottonwood, Montezuma Airport, McGuireville, Middle Verde, Rimrock Airport, Jordan, Rimrock, Out of Africa Wildlife Park, Bignotti and Mountain View Estates.
This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 211 and 224. Interstate 17 between mile markers 286 and 298.
This includes the following recreation areas and campgrounds... Wet Beaver Creek Campground and Windmill Park.
This includes the following swimming holes... Mormons Crossing and Wet Beaver Creek Day Use Area.
info.instruction: Monitor the weather situation closely and be alert for threatening weather conditions.
